gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਖੱਗ ਖੂਨੀ ਦੋੳੂ ਖਤ੍ਰ ਹਾਣੰ ॥
translation: Both had their swords smeared with blood and both worked against Kshatriya discipline.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਖਤ੍ਰ ਖੇਤਾ ਦੋੳੂ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਪਾਣੰ ॥੧੪॥੨੩੨॥
transliteration: Dooo Khatra Khetaa Dooo Chhatra Paanan||14||232||
translation: Both were capable of risking their life in the battlefield.14.232.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਬੀਰ ਬਿਬ ਅਾਸਤ ਧਾਰੇ ਨਿਹਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Dooo Beer Bib Aasat Dhdare Nihdare||
translation: Both the heroes had their weapons in their hands.

gurmukhi: ਰਹੇ ਬਯੋਮ ਮੈ ਭੂਪ ਗੳੁਨੈ ਹਕਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Rahe Byom Mai Bhoop Gadddai Hakdare||
translation: It seemed as if the spirits of the dead kings moving the sky were calling them.

gurmukhi: ਹੱਕਾ ਹੱਕ ਲਾਗੀ ਧਨੰ ਧੰਨ ਜੰਪਿਓ ॥
translation: They were shouting seeing their heroism, they were praising them with the words “Well done, bravo !”

gurmukhi: ਚਕਿਓ ਜੱਛ ਰਾਜੰ ਪ੍ਰਿਥੀ ਲੋਕ ਕੰਪਿਓ ॥੧੫॥੨੩੩॥
translation: The king of Yakshas seeing their bravery was astonished and the earth was trembling.15.233.
(Ultimately) the king Duryodhana was killed in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਭਜੇ ਸਭੈ ਜੋਧਾ ਚਲੀ ਧਾਮ ਧੂਮੰ ॥
translation: All the noisy warriors ran helter-skelter.
(After that) Pandavas ruled over the family of Kauravas unconcerned.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਨਰ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਮੰਝਿ ਸਿੱਝੇ ਹਵਾਲੰ ॥੧੬॥੨੩੪॥
transliteration: Pounar Jaae Kai Manjh(i) Sijjhe Havaalan||16||234||
translation: Then they went to Himalaya mountains.16.234.

gurmukhi: ਤਹਾਂ ੲੇਕ ਗੰਧ੍ਰਬ ਸਿੳੁ ਜੁੱਧ ਮਚਿਓ ॥
transliteration: Tahaan Ek Gaddhrab Siu Juddh Machio||
translation: At that time a war was waged with a Gandharva.
There that Gandharva adopted a wonderful garb.

gurmukhi: ਤਹਾਂ ਸਤ੍ਰੁ ਕੇ ਭੀਮ ਹਸਤੀ ਚਲਾੲੇ ॥
translation: Bhima threw there the elephants of the enemy upwards.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰੈ ਮੱਧ ਗੈਣੰ ਅਜੳੁ ਲੳੁ ਨ ਅਾੲੇ ॥੧੭॥੨੩੫॥
transliteration: Phirai Madhh Gadnan Ajau Lau Na Aae||17||235||
translation: Which are still moving in the sky and have not returned as yet.17.235.
